sentence.Network_en: Each pleat was stitched in place by hand.

sentence.Network_en: In an effort to look older she has pinned her fair hair into a French pleat.

sentence.Network_en: You can pleat palm fronds to make huts, umbrellas and baskets.
sentence.Network_cn: 人们可以把棕榈叶折叠起来盖棚屋, 制伞,编篮子.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: a variant of plait. The written form of the word became obsolete between c.1700 and the end of the 19th cent

entry.def: A pleat in a piece of clothing is a permanent fold that is made in the cloth by folding one part over the other and sewing across the top end of the fold.

means.word_mean: 1. any of various types of fold formed by doubling fabric back upon itself and then pressing or stitching into shape
1. pleat or gather into a ruffle;
